rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {09, 09-1, 09-4}

description: In this unit, students work with a member or members of the literary studies staff to analyse and theorise a topic in literary studies research. The content of the unit is defined by current research practice by staff in literary studies, and may cover topics such as: aesthetics, eco-criticism, literary theory, post-colonial literature, the sociology of literature, a specific genre or period of literary history, and stylistics. Students will have the opportunity to work closely on topics derived from the current research practice of academic staff, and will develop in-depth knowledge of the topic, and a deeper understanding of literary studies research practice.
